description: Construction of 5 x five-bedroom, 2-storey houses (with living accommodation in the roofspace and basements); provision of amenity space and parking for 10 cars and associated vehicular access (following demolition of existing buildings).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: 11013-03-03; 11013-02-06 Rev B; 11013-02-07 Rev A; 11013-02-08 Rev C; 11013-02-09 Rev B; 11013-02-10 Rev A; and 11013-02-13 Rev A  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples and a written specification of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development (including elevations, roofs and hard-standing) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.8 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Prior to the commencement of any part of the development hereby approved, details of the layout of the proposed crossovers on The Avenue and swept path drawings for access/egress to plot 4 shall be submitted for the agreement in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The agreed details shall be implemented in full accordance with the approved plans and in place prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved.  Reason: In the interests of highway and public safety and to comply with saved policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan, policies 6.3, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and local variation policy 6.13 of the Development Management Development Plan Document (EDM3) February 2013 | Prior to the commencement of the development a `Construction Strategy` shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The means of site management and construction shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved Strategy, which should also include details of the means of access for construction works, details of noise, vibration and dust mitigation measures, and an arboricultural method statement to be complied with during the redevelopment.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of hard and soft landscape works, including boundary treatment, together with a 5 year management plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and implemented prior to the occupation of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority and permanently retained thereafter.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the site is landscaped in the interests of the character of the area, in accordance with policies 3.2, 3.8, 4.5 and 4.8 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | The measures to provide at least a 25% carbon reduction through energy efficiency measures and renewable energy on site, as detailed on the drawings and within the energy statement, shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the units hereby approved and retained thereafter or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure the development is acceptable in terms of the Local Planning Authority's energy policies, in accordance with policy 2.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.7 and 7.4 of the London Plan (2011). | Prior to the occupation of any part of the development hereby approved the yellow school road markings on The Avenue shall be removed from the highway surface in their entirety unless where agreed otherwise in writing by the Local Planning Authority  Reason: In the interests of highway safety and to improve the character of the street scape and Conservation Area in accordance with saved policies 9.1 and 4.8 of the adopted UDP, policies 7B and 7C of the draft Development Management Plan DPD, and policies 6.1, 6.13, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2011. | Prior to the commencement of any works on the site, including demolition, tree protection details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The agreed details shall be implemented in full and shall not be altered without the prior consent in writing of the Local Planning Authority. No trees on the site and on highway land which are shown to be retained on the approved plans shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in anyway or removed without the previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that development is being carried out, of trees growing within and adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area, in accordance with policies 4.5 and 4.8 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan, policy 1.1(i) of the Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012), and policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2011. | Prior to the commencement of the development (other than demolition/ enabling/ foundation works) details showing the insulation of the building envelope with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided shall be submitted for the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The agreed details shall be completed prior to occupation of the relevant part of the development and retained thereafter for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory living environment for future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan; policy 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (EDM3) February 2013; and policies 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011. | Works for the demolition of these buildings or any part thereof shall not be commenced before a valid construction contract under which one of the parties is obliged to carry out and itself complete the works of redevelopment of the site for which this permission was granted has been entered into and evidence of such construction contract has first been submitted to and formally accepted in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To prevent premature demolition and the creation of a cleared site which would be harmful to the visual amenity of the area and adversely  affect its character, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, policies LV. 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the draft Development Management Plan Document, and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2011.
